name: Disney's All-Star Music Resort

reviews.text: We are a family of 5 with our kids all under the age of 10. Our youngest still falls under the 3 year old cut off for hotels/tickets however the options for families greater than 4 are limited on Disney property. We selected the All Star Music resort mainly for value as we wanted the in-park experience but didn't want to pay high prices. We were very surprised by our experience. We got to the hotel early (9:00am) and were extremely surprised to find that our room was ready for us! We were given keys and the all-important parking pass. We are Florida residents and with the stroler we find it easier to take our car versus the bus system with the exception of the Magic Kingdom. The parking pass alone equated to $42.00 in savings for the three days we hit the parks.
reviews.title: Good Option for larger families going to Disney

reviews.text: Our room was extremely clean and had two double beds and a pack and play for our youngest to sleep in. The room also had a refrigerator which was a nice to have. My one recommendation here, or with any Disney property is to pay for a preferred room. Unless you are in a deluxe hotel paying for a view in my opinion is not worth the cost as all value and moderate resorts have outdoor corridors and to leave your curtains open means that people can look in to your room while you are looking out. The preferred room does get you closer to the main building for drinks/food etc, and usually the pool area as well. We were in the Calypso building which is closest to the lobby.
reviews.title: Good Time at All Star Music

reviews.text: The beds were extremely comfortable as were the pillows. The room was by no means large, but was open enough to have the pack and play open the entire time and not be in the way. There is a small table and two chairs as well.
reviews.title: It's in the details

reviews.text: We requested additional pillows from Housekeeping which they were happy to bring us and we came back to different towel-animals each day including a bunny rabbit toothbrush holder on the sink and one in our window. On the bed was mousears made out of three towels. This is a nice touch that the kids absolutely love.
reviews.title: Spring Break at Disney World 2013

reviews.text: The grounds are beautiful and the pools were spotless. At night they have a movie outside in the pool area that you can watch from a lounge chair or the pool itself if you wish. There are also scheduled kids activities throughout the day.
reviews.title: Mostly good only downside was 'canteen'!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This resort is a good way to save a lot of money when visiting Disney World, but don't expect a lot of amenities. The rooms are clean and in good condition. One thing that we really missed was not having a coffee maker in the room, so we had to travel to the food court to get coffee. We decided to buy a souvenir mug for about $16 since you get free unlimited refills of hot or cold beverages for the duration of your stay -- only at the hotel, though, not at the parks. This a very busy hotel since a lot of young people stay here to save money. It gets a bit noisy at times. Having bus service to all of the parks is another plus to staying at a Disney resort.
reviews.title: Economical Disney Resort

reviews.text: Made this reservation, as my daughter had an interview for an internship at a nearby hospital. Choose this because it was on property, allowing us access to Disney transport and reservations for a breakfast and a dinner. Usually stay at Beach Club (LOVE), but wanted value for least money. The room was just that, a place to stay. When we checked in we were told that we would be staying in the "Country" part of this resort. This is the most secluded, a good five minute walk to our car or Melody Hall (where the dining area for this resort is located. Very quiet, beautiful view of a swampy area. The room was adequate, nothing fancy, but clean and efficient. Hanging and drawer space was plenty for the two of us. Temp control was spot on. Bathroom clean, appropriate towels, iron, ironing board, and hair dryer. Sink outside of shower area. Well lit room. Housekeeping did what was expected. Piano and Guitar shaped pools were very nice. Four other areas of this resort with different themes. I am sure they would be louder...we were on an outside room the furthest possible area away virtually no one walked past our area. Did not use room service or use the fitness area. Only went to the parks on one day. However, in that one day, we went to three parks (no Animal Kingdom) 15 different rides, 6 at MK, 5 at Epcot, and 4 at HS. Still managed to see the Electical Parade and fireworks at MK. Never ran. We were very efficient.
reviews.title: Just needed a room

reviews.text: The resort was good. We spent three nights and the room was clean. The bathroom was showing it's age. The shower faucet, once set to the desired water temperature wouldn't stay set. Really annoying. Otherwise, it was very good and as expensive as you'd expect at Disney.
reviews.title: Pretty Good

reviews.text: This was the worst hotel I have stayed in. It was so dirty! There were cob webs hanging from the ceiling, cigarette burn marks on the sink, dirt in the corners. I have stayed in better $39.00 budget hotels. Guest services did not care. They just laughed and said yes we know. There is no were on their web site to complain and no one to call. Disney just does not care. The parks are not handicapped friendly. Attendants were very rude. Needless to say this was not a magical moment! There web site is terrible, shuts down, takes forever to load, kicks you off pages. Stay off property if possible.
reviews.title: Horrible hotel

reviews.text: We chose to get a family suite at All Star Music instead of a regular room at a mid priced Disney location. We loved the separate bedroom, kitchen and especially the two bathrooms - for only about $400 more for the week. The rooms were large (bathrooms were tiny though), clean and well appointed. The couch (makes into a bed) and chair (also makes into a bed) were rather hard, but OK. The worst part was the noise. Every time someone in a near-by room flushed their toilet, we could hear it. Maybe being on the top floor would help, our room was on the 1st floor. It was also loud when someone walked by rolling their suitcases - sometimes sounding like an airport. Also might help if you were on the upper levels. All in all, we would do this again, but ask to be upstairs. The family suites are very close to the dining area/ bus pickup. This is a big plus. The weather was cold while we were there so we didn't use the pool, but a lot of kids did. They heat the water to 80 degrees. The staff at the hotel was excellent. Very friendly and knowledgable. The housekeeping was very good the first few days, but there must have been a change of workers because the last few days left something to be desired. I left a note with the tip asking for tissues (ours ran out) and had to call again later to get them. We drank tea each morning, and they left more coffee, but no tea (not a big deal, we just had to go to the dining area to get more). All little things, but we expected more from Disney. We probably won't be back again until we have grandchildren, and by then, who knows how different things will be there? They are building, building, building..... pretty soon it will just be all one big hotel complex.
reviews.title: Wonderful location, big room - but noisy!

reviews.text: This was our first time to Disney. We are a family of five so we needed a suite. We also knew that we would not be spending much time in our room so we wanted to keep our money for the parks and kids' activities. This resort is definitely worth every penny. Our room was wonderful so clean and bright - and had two bathrooms (which works well for 4 girls to share!). The food at the quick service was very delicious however I think they need to have more healthy options (not fries with everything!) if you want salad, you have to buy it separately or use a "snack" or "dessert" option from your meal plan. There was always lots of activities for the kids and the nightly movies outdoors was a big hit. We would definitely go back again and stay at this resort.
reviews.title: Great Value!

reviews.text: Took a last-minute trip to WDW for 2 night with my 12-year old. We had previously stayed at the moderate resorts and once at the Contemporary. Since it was just a quick trip this time and we weren't planning to spend much time at the hotel, I decided to try the All Star Music resort.
reviews.title: Pleasantly Surprised

reviews.text: I was pleased with the size of the room - it was nearly the same as the other hotel levels. Rooms were clean and the A/C worked well. I wish they would provide the more elaborate towel creations like at the higher end resorts. And I wish they would get rid of the old, potentially dirty bedspreads and replace them with clean, white duvets that get washed after each guest.
reviews.title: Great value resort

reviews.text: The grounds were nicely landscaped and I did not feel I was in the middle of a parking lot like I had feared.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.text: The food court is a step down from the other levels and feels more like a cafeteria, but the food itself is identical to the moderates. Food is definitely not as good as the luxury levels.
reviews.title: Fleas!

reviews.text: If you want value, the All-Star Resorts are for you. If you want luxury, don't come here. These are very basic motel room type accomodations. It was a friends long weekend away to run a Disney race so these accomodations were perfect for us. There pools are good sizes and never seemed busy. The front staff is very good and solved all our issues.
reviews.title: Great Value!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I recently spent 3 nights at the All-Star Music resort. We are Disney Vacation Club members and have been staying at the deluxe resorts for the past few years but we needed a hotel last minute that was affordable and All-Star Music it was. As a child I have stayed at the All-Star resorts MANY times. The resorts are very family friendly and oriented. The resorts are large with only having a bus stop at the front so if you stay in a back building, which we did, you have a little bit of a walk. This was not a problem for us but may be for some and this is why these resorts offer preferred buildings that you can pay extra for. Our room was clean and comfortable but compared to the deluxe resorts they were very small and the bed quality is obvious, again for us this was not a big deal. The food options at the food court were plentiful and affordable! If you have a Tables of Wonderland discount card, the discount offers 20% at the food court which was great! The pools were clean as well as the pool furniture. The only negative experience we had was when we were checking out, we waiting over an hour for bell services to get to our room to get our luggage. This was VERY inconvenient and we called to complain twice and nothing was done about it. So, if you're looking for an affordable Disney hotel, The All-Star resorts offer a great vacation but with no luxury.
reviews.title: With Disney you get what you pay for.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I, were very satisfied with our room, although it is ot a superior room it is nice and clean, with little gadgets unique to Disney. We had bought the Play, Eat and Fun Package (quick meals) and were very pleased with the choice of restaurants. We had a very good deal and had a room near the restaurants and transportation. Few years ago, we were staying at the Disney Caribbean Beach Resort which is a moderate hotel, but far more expensive. The All Star suited the purpose of our trip: park the car and leave there, jump in the Disney Transportation Bus and relax. Plus, we benefited of early entrance to a specific Park every day. The only disappointment was that they had removed the Disney characters in the middle of the main pool, as shown on their web site.
reviews.title: Affordable on site resort

reviews.text: I would recommend it to anyone.
reviews.title: Good Hotel with Disney Perks

reviews.text: Now if you are looking for fancy, do not stay here. If you are at Walt Disney World on a budget, this is one of the resorts for you. I have been to Disney World four times with my family. My family includes myself, my mom, my dad, and my two sisters. My sisters are 10 and 3. We stayed at the All-Stars Sports and Port Orleans Riverside before. We stayed from February 28 through March 8. We enjoyed getting picked up from the airport and taken to our resorts on Disney's Magical Express. I loved the video. It was very informational, yet fun to watch. Upon arrival, my father got us checked in. This was a very easy process because we had already did the online check-in. The outside of the resort was very nice looking. They took care of everything so well. The lobby was not stunning, but it still looked good. There was a big couch facing a TV with Disney Cartoons. The restrooms in Melody Hall were nice. Also, inside Melody Hall was a food court, arcade, and store. Mastero Mickey's, the store, was well stocked. My family went in there at least once a day and still found new stuff to look at. We ate at the Intermission Food Court a lot since we had quick service dining. When you exit the main building and head towards the rooms, the landscape is beautiful. Straight ahead is a guitar-shaped swimming pool. The Calypso Pool is huge. It is also heated. Even though a couple of nights it was chilly, there were still people swimming, and the lifeguards were wearing winter hats and gloves. Our room was in the Jazz Inn section. There was a fountain in the middle. The room was a family suite. It was great for our family. Mom and Dad slept in the bedroom while the kids slept in the living room. I was on the pull-out couch, and my sisters were on the pull-out bench and chair. The room was just re-painted. It had a lot of space and looked nice. The resort was crowded when we were there. A lot of teams who complete at the ESPN Wide World of Sports Complex stay at the All-Star Resorts. There just happen to be two cheer leading compititions when we were there. The food court had very good food. Notable Games Arcade had a lot of games. I enjoyed setting records at the basketball games. The resort also had a laundry room. The bus wait times were a little long. The bus rides were not very long except for Downtown Disney, which are also extremely crowded because they go to all the All-Star Resorts. The Disney Cast Members were great as always. Even when we needed something extra, they were there right away. The room key scanner ran out of battery at our room. We couldn't get into our room for awhile. The Cast Members helped out a lot and solved the problem. Overall the hotel was good, and the Disney theme made it better.
reviews.title: Great Family Hotel in Disney

description: Disney's All-Star Music Resort is a Disney Value Resort hotel featuring giant icons that pay homage to classic music genres—including Broadway show tunes, calypso, country, jazz and rock n' roll.
